name: ChatGPT Free
compliance_summary: OpenAI maintains SOC 2 Type 2 compliance and has documented GDPR compliance measures. However, ChatGPT Free lacks HIPAA compliance and enterprise-specific compliance controls.
summary_and_recommendation: BLOCK for enterprise use. ChatGPT Free poses significant risks due to default training data usage (with opt-out available but not prominent), lack of enterprise admin controls, indefinite data retention, and no organizational oversight capabilities. Suitable only for public content generation with explicit training opt-out enabled.
assessment_notes: High confidence based on comprehensive public documentation and help center articles. Limited enterprise-specific documentation available for free tier users.

required_permissions: No specific Azure permissions - web-based service
recommended_restrictions: Implement URL filtering for ChatGPT domains
Deploy DLP policies to detect sensitive data uploads

recommendations.title: Block ChatGPT Free for Enterprise Use
recommendations.description: The free version lacks enterprise controls and uses data for training by default. Block access and direct users to approved alternatives or enterprise-grade solutions.

recommendations.title: Implement Network-Level Blocking
recommendations.description: Use firewall rules and web filtering to block access to chat.openai.com and related domains for enterprise networks.

recommendations.title: User Education and Training
recommendations.description: Educate users about the risks of using free AI tools with corporate data, emphasizing training data usage and lack of enterprise controls.

recommendations.title: Evaluate Enterprise Alternatives
recommendations.description: Consider OpenAI's enterprise offerings or other enterprise-grade AI solutions that provide proper data controls and admin oversight.

detailed_assessment.compliance_summary: OpenAI maintains SOC 2 Type 2 compliance and has documented GDPR compliance measures. However, ChatGPT Free lacks HIPAA compliance and enterprise-specific compliance controls.
detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: BLOCK for enterprise use. ChatGPT Free poses significant risks due to default training data usage (with opt-out available but not prominent), lack of enterprise admin controls, indefinite data retention, and no organizational oversight capabilities. Suitable only for public content generation with explicit training opt-out enabled.

geographic_control.justification: External servers, unclear location - OpenAI operates globally with servers in multiple jurisdictions. While enterprise plans mention data residency controls, free tier users have no geographic control options and limited visibility into data processing locations.

encryption_standards.justification: Enterprise-Grade Encryption - OpenAI documentation confirms AES-256 encryption at rest and TLS 1.2+ encryption in transit. Published encryption specifications are available and meet enterprise standards.

data_retention.justification: Indefinite/Unclear Retention - Chat history is retained indefinitely by default unless manually deleted by users. While the policy is clearly stated and deleted chats are hard deleted within 30 days, the default behavior is indefinite retention with no automatic deletion policies for active conversations.

model_training.justification: Default training use with difficult opt-out - ChatGPT Free uses conversations for model training by default. While OpenAI now provides opt-out options through settings (Data Controls > Improve the model for everyone), this is not prominently presented during onboarding and requires user action to disable.

data_sharing.justification: Broad sharing or unclear sharing practices - OpenAI's privacy policy mentions sharing with service providers and for legal compliance. While some third-party relationships are disclosed, the free tier lacks detailed transparency about specific data sharing arrangements.

admin_management.justification: No Admin Oversight - ChatGPT Free provides individual accounts only with no organizational visibility, centralized management capabilities, admin dashboard, or user provisioning. Organizations cannot manage employee access or monitor usage.

audit_capabilities.justification: No Audit Capabilities - Free version provides no activity logs accessible to administrators, no usage tracking for organizations, and no audit trail capabilities. Individual users can see their own history but organizations have no oversight.

integration.justification: No Enterprise Integration - ChatGPT Free requires username/password authentication only, with no SSO support, no enterprise identity management integration, and no API access for enterprise management or provisioning.

regulatory_violations.justification: Fully Compliant - OpenAI maintains SOC 2 Type 2 compliance, has documented GDPR compliance measures, and provides Business Associate Agreements for enterprise customers. The company demonstrates strong regulatory compliance frameworks.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Basic Transparency - OpenAI provides general data processing descriptions and retention periods with some third-party relationships disclosed. However, the free tier lacks detailed data flow diagrams and specific subprocessor information that enterprise users typically require.

documentation_and_support.justification: No Transparency - While OpenAI provides extensive documentation for enterprise products and general privacy policies, the free tier has extremely limited security documentation specific to individual users, no dedicated support (community forums only), and lacks enterprise-specific transparency reports or direct communication channels.

use_case_multiplier_applied.data_classification: Should only be used with Public/Marketing Data
